jibe.sdk.client
Interface JibeServiceListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
JibeServiceListenerAdapter
public interface JibeServiceListener

A callback interface, to be implemented by client applications, which allows the Jibe Realtime Service to pass a notification to the client applications once a connection to the requested Jibe Service has been established.

Methods on the Jibe Service API can only be invoked after a connection to the SDK service has been established. Because connecting to the Jibe Service service is an asynchronous operation in Android, clients should register a callback that implements this interface, and then wait to be informed of a connection being successfully established, before calling any other Jibe Service methods.

Method Detail

handleServiceConnected

void handleServiceConnected(java.lang.String serviceClassName)
Called when the client has connected successfully to the Jibe Service API.

Once it receives this notification, the client can then proceed with calling Jibe Service API functions.

If the same handler is being used to listen to several services (for example, for both FileTransfer and ChatSession), the serviceClassName parameter should be examined, to determine which service has actually just established a connection.

Parameters:
serviceClassName - The name of the service class for which a connection has been established.

handleServiceConnectFailed

void handleServiceConnectFailed(java.lang.String serviceClassName,
                                JibeServiceListener.ConnectFailedReason reason)
Called when the connection to the engine failed for a specific reason. The service instance is invalid after this call an need to be created again.

Parameters:
serviceClassName - class name of the service which failed to connect
reason - The reason why the connection is not possible

handleServiceDisconnected

void handleServiceDisconnected(java.lang.String serviceClassName)
